cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles ESE of Marathon, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the Florida Keys/southern peninsula today and then northwest toward the central Gulf Coast (MS/AL shoreline) by late Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast near the Mississippi-Alabama border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama–Florida border westward to east of Morgan City, LA (TS Watch); Mississippi–Alabama border westward to Mouth of Mississippi River (Surge Watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, South Florida peninsula, and central U.S. Gulf Coast from AL to southeast LA
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – isolated totals up to 8" possible
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts (≥39 mph) possible this morning/afternoon; sustained gale-force winds unlikely (≤3 % probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the southeast Florida Atlantic coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with locally heavier bands; potential urban/poor-drainage flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief waterspouts or isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands possible; reduced visibility and lightning in squalls may disrupt terminal operations.
